home.title: Message from the Ambassador!
home.paragraph1: Welcome to the official website of the Embassy of Senegal in Rwanda. The entire team is pleased to welcome you!
home.paragraph2: Opened in February 2021, the Embassy of Senegal, located in the vibrant Kimihurura neighborhood at the heart of the beautiful and green city of Kigali, symbolizes the commitment of the highest Senegalese authorities to maintaining strong and fruitful diplomatic relations with Rwanda, as well as other countries under its jurisdiction, including Burundi, Comoros, Tanzania, and Seychelles.
home.paragraph3: Through this platform, in addition to secure access to information on bilateral relations between Senegal and the above-mentioned countries, you will benefit from a wide range of consular services (entry visas to Senegal, civil status, registration, etc.), discover the rich facets—particularly touristic—of the Land of Teranga, while also following its political, economic, social, sports, and cultural news.
home.paragraph4: The website also provides, through useful links, valuable information on “Senegal Vision 2050” and investment opportunities in the country, as well as on the institutions of the Republic of Senegal.
home.closing: Dear visitors, this website is yours. Feel free to explore its various sections and, above all, share your suggestions with us to help improve our services.
home.signature: Thank you for your visit! Jeureujeuf !!!

images.caption: Diplomatic cooperation between Senegal and Rwanda

content: Head of Mission
H.E. Doudou SOW, Ambassador of Senegal to Rwanda

A graduate of Cheikh Anta Diop University of Dakar (UCAD) with a Master’s degree in Modern Literature in 1992, H.E. Doudou SOW served in the education sector until 2005, the year he was admitted to the National School of Administration (ENA), Diplomacy Section.

He was subsequently assigned to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Directorate for Europe, where he served as Head of the Europe Division from 2009 to 2010. He was then posted to the Embassy of Senegal in Kingston as Second Counsellor from 2010 to 2011, and later as First Counsellor from 2011 to 2012. From 2012 to 2015, he also served as First Counsellor at the Embassy of Senegal in Brasília.

Between 2015 and 2016, he served as Adviser to the Ambassador and Secretary-General of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Senegalese Abroad, before being posted to the Embassy of Senegal in Seoul, where he served as Minister-Counsellor from 2018 to 2019.
Since September 2019, he has been serving as Ambassador of the Republic of Senegal to Rwanda.

images.caption: H.E. Doudou SOW, Ambassador of Senegal to Rwanda

content: JURISDICTION
In addition to the Republic of Rwanda, the Embassy’s jurisdiction also covers Burundi, the Union of the Comoros, the Seychelles, and the United Republic of Tanzania.
HONORARY CONSULS
lists: In Tanzania, the Embassy is represented by the Office of the Honorary Consul, located at P.O. Box 8693, 520 Haile Selassie Road, Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. Email: consulatsen.tz@gmail.com
In Burundi, the Seychelles, and the Comoros, the Embassy relies on Senegalese community associations established in these countries.

rows: Avenue 144, Rue 143, Villa 07, Nyamirambo, Kigali, Rwanda

content: Missions
The missions of the Embassy of Senegal, as elsewhere, include representation, protection, negotiation, and information.

The Embassy of Senegal in Rwanda monitors bilateral cooperation between the two countries. It represents the Senegalese State at all official ceremonies and events organized in the host country. The Head of the Diplomatic Mission represents the Head of State and all Ministers of the Senegalese Government.

In this capacity, the Embassy protects the interests of Senegal and Senegalese nationals, negotiates agreements or other forms of cooperation with Rwandan authorities on behalf of the State of Senegal. Furthermore, the Embassy of Senegal in Rwanda provides consular assistance and protection to Senegalese nationals residing in the host country and safeguards their interests. It also provides information on current developments in Rwanda as well as opportunities that may be of interest to Senegal.

The Embassy also promotes trade relations between Rwanda and Senegal by facilitating contacts between business communities and employers’ organizations of both countries. The Embassy of Senegal in Rwanda carries out these same functions for the other countries within its jurisdiction.
CONSULAR SERVICES
The Embassy of the Republic of Senegal in Rwanda provides Senegalese citizens residing in or visiting Rwanda, as well as other users, with a wide range of consular services.
Our services include in particular:
lists: Civil status transcription (birth, marriage, death, etc.);
Issuance of various other administrative documents;
content_end: For any request or additional information, please do not hesitate to contact us.
We invite you to click on the images below to view the documents required to be sent to or presented at the Embassy.

content: GENERAL PRESENTATION
ABOUT SENEGAL
Senegal, known as the “Land of Teranga” (hospitality), is located in West Africa.
lists: Head of State: His Excellency Mr. Bassirou Diomaye Diakhar FAYE since March 2024
Bordering countries: Mauritania, Mali, Guinea, Guinea-Bissau, The Gambia
Climate: tropical climate with a dry season (November to June) and a rainy season (July to October)
Vegetation: forest in the south, savannah in the center, steppe in the north
content_end: Flag of Senegal: The national flag consists of three equal vertical stripes—green, yellow, and red—with a green five-pointed star centered on the yellow stripe.
Seals: Senegal has two official seals: the “Lion Passant Seal” reserved for the President of the Republic, and the “Baobab Seal” used for public administrative acts.
Coat of Arms of Senegal: The coat of arms features a lion on a red background and a baobab tree on a yellow background, topped by a green five-pointed star.

bilateral.title: Senegal – Rwanda Relations
paragraphs: Senegal and Rwanda maintain dynamic and friendly political relations, marked by continuous dialogue between their leaders and regular high-level visits.
In this context, Senegal decided in 2019 to open an embassy in Kigali with a resident ambassador, following the opening of the Rwandan Embassy in Dakar in 2011.
Beyond political ties, both countries are developing strong cooperation in cultural and military fields, while exploring new areas such as health, air transport, and the digital economy.
